# Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

We, as contributors and maintainers of this project, pledge to make participation
a respectful, inclusive, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of
experience level, background, or personal identity.

This project exists to learn, build, and explore complex systems together in a
constructive and professional manner.

---

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment include:

- Being respectful and considerate in discussions
- Providing constructive feedback and technical critique
- Being open to different viewpoints and approaches
- Focusing on the problem, not the person
- Helping others learn and improve

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

- Harassment, discrimination, or personal attacks
- Trolling, insulting, or demeaning comments
- Dismissing others based on experience level or background
- Publishing private information without consent
- Any behavior intended to create a hostile environment

---

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies within all project spaces, including:

- GitHub issues and pull requests
- Discussions and code reviews
- Commit messages and documentation
- Any other communication channels related to the project

---

## Enforcement

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying standards and enforcing this Code
of Conduct in a fair and consistent manner.

Unacceptable behavior may result in actions such as:

- Requesting changes or clarification
- Temporary or permanent removal from project spaces
- Rejection of contributions that violate these guidelines

Decisions made by maintainers are final and made in the interest of the project and
its community.

---

## Reporting

If you experience or witness behavior that violates this Code of Conduct, please
report it to the project maintainer privately.

All reports will be reviewed and handled with discretion and respect.

---

## Acknowledgement

This Code of Conduct is inspired by the principles of open-source collaboration and
professional software development practices.

By participating in this project, you agree to abide by these guidelines.
